name: AberOWL
description: AberOWL is a framework for ontology-based access to biological data. It consists of a repository of bio-ontologies, a set of webservices which provide access to OWL(-EL) reasoning over the ontologies, and several frontends which utilise the ontology repository and reasoning services to provide access to specific biological datasets.
contact.name: Ali Syed

name: AgroPortal
description: A vocabulary and ontology repository for agronomy and related domains.
contact.name: Clement Jonquet

name: BioContext
description: BioContext contains modular JSON-LD contexts for bioinformatics data.
contact.name: Chris Mungall

name: Biolink Model Registry
description: A modeling paradigm-specific registry of prefixes and their URL expansions
contact.name: Deepak Unni

name: BioPortal Prefixes
description: The BioPortal is a less stringent registry of biomedical ontologies than the OBO Foundry
contact.name: John Graybeal

name: Bioregistry
description: The Bioregistry is integrative meta-registry of biological databases, ontologies, and nomenclatures that is backed by an open database.
contact.name: Charles Tapley Hoyt

name: Cellosaurus Registry
description: The set of prefixes used in the Cellosaurus resource
contact.name: Amos Bairoch

name: Chemical Information Ontology
description: Contains entries for various database identifiers
contact.name: Egon Willighagen

name: Crop Ontology Curation Tool
description: The Crop Ontology (CO) current objective is to compile validated concepts along with their inter-relationships on anatomy, structure and phenotype of Crops, on trait measurement and methods as well as on Germplasm with the multi-crop passport terms
contact.name: Elizabeth Arnaud

name: EcoPortal
description: The LifeWatch ERIC repository of semantic resources for the ecological domain.
contact.name: Xeni Kechagioglou

name: EDAM Ontology
description: EDAM is a comprehensive ontology of well-established, familiar concepts that are prevalent within computational biology, bioinformatics, and bioimage informatics. EDAM includes types of data and data identifiers, data formats, operations, and topics related to data analysis in life sciences. EDAM provides a set of concepts with preferred terms and synonyms, related terms, definitions, and other information - organised into a simple and intuitive hierarchy for convenient use.
contact.name: Matúš Kalaš

name: FAIRSharing
description: A curated, informative and educational resource on data and metadata standards, inter-related to databases and data policies.
contact.name: Allyson Lister

name: Gene Ontology Registry
description: A database-specific registry supporting curation in the Gene Ontology
contact.name: Chris Mungall

name: HL7 External Code Systems
description: HL7 External Code Systems are stored within the greater OID system
contact.name: W. Ted Klein

name: Identifiers.org
description: The Identifiers.org Resolution Service provides consistent access to life science data using Compact Identifiers. Compact Identifiers consist of an assigned unique prefix and a local provider designated accession number (prefix:accession).
contact.name: Henning Hermjakob

name: Name-to-Thing
description: An ARK resolver as well as resolver built with common prefixes as in Identifiers.org
contact.name: John Kunze

name: National Center for Biotechnology Information Registry
description: A database-specific registry supporting curation in the NCBI GenBank and related NCBI resources
contact.name: GenBank Support

name: OBO Foundry
description: The mission of the OBO Foundry is to develop a family of interoperable ontologies that are both logically well-formed and scientifically accurate.
contact.name: Chris Mungall

name: Ontology Lookup Service
description: The Ontology Lookup Service (OLS) is a repository for biomedical ontologies that aims to provide a single point of access to the latest ontology versions.
contact.name: Henriette Harmse

name: OntoBee
description: Ontobee is aimed to facilitate ontology data sharing, visualization, query, integration, and analysis.
contact.name: Yongqun Oliver He

name: Prefix.cc
description: A web-developer centric archive of prefixes and URI prefixes
contact.name: Richard Cyganiak

name: Prefix Commons
description: A registry of commonly used prefixes in the life sciences and linked data
contact.name: Michel Dumontier

name: Registry of Research Data Repositories
description: Re3data is a global registry of research data repositories that covers research data repositories from different academic disciplines.
contact.name: Michael Witt

name: UniProt Cross-ref database
description: The cross-references section of UniProtKB entries displays explicit and implicit links to databases such as nucleotide sequence databases, model organism databases and genomics and proteomics resources.
contact.name: Alex Bateman

name: Wikidata Property
description: An open, community-curated knowledgebase that contains several properties corresponding to resources listed in other biomedical registries.
contact.name: WikiData Support
